author: @newstrack_eng
title: Delhi Gripped by Dense Fog, Travel Disruptions Continue, Trains and Flights Delayed | NewsTrack English 1
text: NEW DELHI: Delhi woke up to a thick blanket of fog this Thursday, causing significant delays in both train and air travel. The dense fog and poor visibility in the national capital have resulted in disruptions to the schedules of several trains and flights. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted that this foggy spell might persist for the next two days. Numerous trains, particularly those bound for Delhi, are experiencing delays. According to Deepak Kumar, the Chief Public Relations Officer (CPRO) for Northern Railways, at least 11 Delhi-bound trains have been affected, including notable services like the Mumbai CSMT-Amritsar Express, Farakka Express, Lucknow Mail, and others. Passengers are facing hardships due to these delays. Subhash, a traveler, mentioned, "Several trains are getting delayed. Eight trains that were supposed to arrive last night are still pending. Those scheduled for this morning are running late by almost 3-4 hours, and there's uncertainty about their arrival." The impact on air travel has also been notable, with Mohd Shahrukh, a passenger, expressing frustration over a three-hour flight delay. "Our plans for an important event have been derailed due to this delay. Many people are encountering difficulties because of flight delays," he stated. Visibility at the Indira Gandhi International (IGI) Airport improved today, although the morning witnessed extremely low visibility, dropping to 150 meters due to dense fog. The Runway Visual Range (RVR) has been fluctuating between 400 to 800 meters, according to IMD reports. The India Meteorological Department has issued a dense fog advisory for several regions, including Punjab, Haryana, Delhi, Uttar Pradesh, north Rajasthan, and north Madhya Pradesh. They advised caution while traveling, urging the use of fog lights and suggesting staying updated with transportation services regarding journey schedules. IMD has warned of continued dense fog over the next three days in northwestern and parts of adjoining central India. Satellite imagery confirms the presence of widespread fog affecting the North India region. Thursday morning witnessed a thick fog cover enveloping Delhi and neighboring areas, leading to significantly reduced visibility on roads and causing delays in numerous trains and flights. Yesterday alone, more than 20 trains and 134 flights were delayed due to the prevailing low visibility conditions. [Safety Tips: These tips will keep you in mind so that your life does not fall into trouble due to fog](https://english.newstracklive.com/news/safety-tips-these-tips-will-keep-you-in-mind-so-that-your-life-does-not-fall-into-trouble-due-to-fog-sc73-nu371-ta371-1306941-1.html)

author: admin3
title: JustiÃ§a aumenta penas de nove ex-militares do Chile por Caravana da Morte de Pinochet
text:
28/12/2023 - 19:19
A JustiÃ§a chilena aumentou nesta quinta-feira (28) as condenaÃ§Ãµes de nove militares da reserva por sua participaÃ§Ã£o no assassinato de 15 pessoas durante o caso chamado de â€œCaravana da Morteâ€, nas primeiras semanas da ditadura de Augusto Pinochet.
O brigadeiro Pedro Espinoza e o coronel Juan Chiminelli, os dois militares da reserva que haviam sido condenados a cinco anos de prisÃ£o em 2018 como autores dos homicÃ­dios, agora deverÃ£o cumprir uma pena de 15 anos, segundo a decisÃ£o da Suprema Corte, o mÃ¡ximo tribunal do paÃ­s.
Outros seis militares receberam condenaÃ§Ãµes entre cinco e 10 anos por sua participaÃ§Ã£o nos crimes, ocorridos na cidade de La Serena, a cerca de 500 km de Santiago.
O general reformado Juan Emilio Cheyre, que, em 2003, foi o primeiro comandante em chefe do ExÃ©rcito a pedir um â€œnunca maisâ€ para abusos dos direitos humanos, foi condenado a cinco anos por sua cumplicidade no caso, mas ele recebeu o benefÃ­cio da liberdade vigiada.
A Caravana da Morte Ã© um dos casos mais emblemÃ¡ticos dos crimes cometidos durante a ditadura de Pinochet (1973-1990), que deixou mais de 3.200 mortos.
Dias depois do golpe de Estado de 11 de setembro de 1973 que depÃ´s o governo do socialista Salvador Allende (1970-1973) e instaurou a ditadura de Pinochet, uma comitiva militar liderada pelo general Sergio Arellano percorreu de helicÃ³ptero vÃ¡rias cidades do paÃ­s para executar partidÃ¡rios de Allende que haviam sido presos.
Segundo a decisÃ£o judicial, Pinochet ordenou â€œpercorrer diversas cidades do paÃ­s, para acelerar os processos que afetavam os presos polÃ­ticos e (â€¦) avanÃ§ar com sua execuÃ§Ã£oâ€.
Nesse contexto, as 15 vÃ­timas de La Serena foram levadas a um polÃ­gono de tiro, onde foram â€œexecutadas sem julgamento prÃ©vio, mediante disparos efetuados pelo pessoal do ExÃ©rcito, alguns deles mortos com um tiro de graÃ§aâ€, diz o tribunal.
A Suprema Corte ordenou Ã  Receita Federal a pagar uma reparaÃ§Ã£o de cerca de 3,6 milhÃµes de dÃ³lares (17,4 milhÃµes de reais) a 32 familiares das vÃ­timas.
Pinochet, que faleceu em 2006, foi processado e ficou sob prisÃ£o domiciliar por esse caso, o primeiro pelo qual teve que comparecer ante a JustiÃ§a chilena.
Mas, em julho de 2002, foi exonerado pelo Supremo Tribunal por uma alegada demÃªncia que o impedia de se defender em tribunal.
A decisÃ£o desta quinta-feira Ã© uma das vÃ¡rias condenaÃ§Ãµes definitivas emitidas neste ano pela JustiÃ§a chilena por crimes cometidos durante a ditadura, quando o golpe de Estado completou 50 anos.
axl/ps/dga/dd/ic

author: MENAFN
title: Ukrainian Troops Defending Zaporizhzhia Region Receive Donated Equipment | MENAFN.COM
text: Forgot Username or Password Date (MENAFN- UkrinForm) Aid was provided to the military units operating on the Orikhiv axis. Ivan Fedorov , chief of the Zaporizhzhia Regional Military Administration, reported this via Telegram, Ukrinform saw. "Today we're in the Orihiv direction... Aid has been handed over. On Easter, as on all other days, the most important thing we can do is to help. This time it's help to four brigades," Fedorov noted. According to the official, more than 450 various drones (FPV, Mavic 3, and Mavic 3 Thermal night vision quadcopters), ï¸ nine e-warfare devices, ï¸ 10 Starlink systems, as well as ï¸ an ambulance were handed over to the military. "We thank our defenders who fight and protect our Homeland every day!" remarked the administration head. As reported earlier, UAH 162 million worth of equipment and machinery were purchased for Ukrainian defenders fighting in Zaporizhzhia region. This is an illustrative photo MENAFN05052024000193011044ID1108175902 Legal Disclaimer: MENAFN provides the information â€œas isâ€ without warranty of any kind. author: Ana Carrillo
title: Luca Onestini desata las risas de sus fans con su comentario a Mayka Rivera - GH DÃšO
text:
> Luca Onestini ha regresado al platÃ³ de 'GH DÃšO' para vivir la final del concurso junto al resto de expulsados Mayka Rivera, quinta finalista de 'GH DÃšO', ha grabado un story con el hermano de Gianmarco Onestini A los fans del exnovio de Cristina Porta les ha hecho mucha gracia lo que le ha dicho a la exparticipante de 'La isla de las tentaciones' Luca Onestini, primer expulsado de la segunda ediciÃ³n de 'GH DÃšO', ha regresado al platÃ³ del programa para vivir la final desde allÃ­ junto al resto de expulsados y se ha reencontrado con Mayka Rivera , que saliÃ³ de la casa de Guadalix de la Sierra el pasado domingo en la primera semifinal como quinta finalista. Cuando Marta Flich le ha dado paso, el italiano le ha dicho que la exparticipante de 'La isla de las tentaciones' le habÃ­a pedido que dijera que LucÃ­a SÃ¡nchez merece ser la ganadora.
Mayka y Luca Onestini muestran su complicidad en platÃ³ y se sinceran: "El reencuentro ha estado bien" MÃS MÂª JesÃºs Ruiz, emocionada por entregar el maletÃ­n de â€˜GH DÃšOâ€™, como ganadora de la primera ediciÃ³n: â€œEl premio es el cariÃ±o y el amor de la audienciaâ€ Isa Pantoja responde a la propuesta de Asraf Beno: "Ese es mi pensamiento" "Ivana se ve nerviosa; Finito siente una gran atracciÃ³n": lo que dicen los gestos de la pareja mÃ¡s popular de GH DÃšO Unos minutos antes, Mayka habÃ­a compartido en sus stories de Instagram un vÃ­deo de ambos juntos que estÃ¡ corriendo como la pÃ³lvora en la red social X. La razÃ³n es que a los fans del exnovio de Cristina Porta les hace mucha gracia el comentario que le hace a la murciana y no paran de compartirlo para despertar las risas de otros seguidores del formato mientras disfrutan de la gran final, en la que Manuel GonzÃ¡lez, LucÃ­a SÃ¡nchez y Asraf Beno se disputan el maletÃ­n.
"Â¿QuiÃ©n quieres que gane 'Gran Hermano' esta noche?", le pregunta Mayka a Luca, que contesta entre risas: "TÃº, la verdad es que siempre he esperado que que ganases tÃº, siempre he sido tu primer fan y tambiÃ©n el Ãºnico creo" . La murciana le reprochaba que no se lo estuviera tomando en serio y le pedÃ­a que dijera que apoya a LucÃ­a para convertirse en la ganadora y tomar el relevo de MarÃ­a JesÃºs Ruiz. "Vacilando a tope", "Â¡Vaya vacile!", "El nivel de vacile que tiene es insuperable", son algunos de los comentarios que han escrito los fans del italiano al ver este vÃ­deo.

author: PA News Agency
title: New Yearâ€™s Eve revellers urged to wrap up warm as temperatures plummet | Hackney Gazette
text: New Yearâ€™s Eve revellers have been urged to wrap up warm as conditions across many parts of the UK could feel close to freezing as the clock strikes midnight. The weather is expected to remain unsettled with further strong winds and heavy rain throughout the last weekend of 2023. A yellow weather warning for wind covering parts of Wales and the east of England has been issued and will come into force between 11am on Saturday and 3am on Sunday. A spell of strong and gusty winds will move east across England and Wales, bringing some disruption to travel and services, the Met Office said. A yellow weather warning for rain has been issued covering Wales between 10am and 6pm on Saturday, which may lead to flooding and transport disruption. A yellow weather warning for rain will also come into effect at 4am on Saturday for Northern Ireland, due to be in force until 11am the same day. The fresh warnings come on the heels of a gusty few days brought on by Storm Gerrit. Hundreds of homes in Scotland remain without power as the post-storm clean up begins, but electricity bosses are â€œvery confidentâ€ that the remaining 750 properties will be reconnected on Friday. Thousands of properties in Ceredigion were without power on Thursday after lightning struck supplies in Wales. The Met Office said its Irish counterpart, Met Eireann, could name another storm â€“ Storm Hank â€“ as a â€œdeep area of low pressureâ€ pushes strong winds across the Republic of Ireland on Saturday. Meteorologist Alex Burkill said Saturday is going to turn â€œwet and windyâ€ across the UK with a band of â€œintense rainâ€ pushing its way eastwards and north-eastwards to bring a risk of gales and possibly â€œsevere galesâ€ in exposed spots. In a forecast video, Mr Burkill said northern areas as well as high ground areas in Scotland are likely to see â€œsignificant snowâ€, with possibly 10 to 20cm of snow building up on the highest grounds. â€œThereâ€™s a potential for some snow accumulations, even as low as perhaps 100m up, we could see some slushy snow, so likely to see some travel disruption again, because of the wind, the rain and some snow like weâ€™ve seen over some recent days,â€ he said. Blustery and showery conditions are set to continue into Sunday, with the heaviest and most frequent rainfall across western parts of the UK. The mercury is expected to drop on Sunday. Mr Burkill said: â€œAs we look towards the end of the day on New Yearâ€™s Eve, and the blustery showery theme does continue, some of those showers should start to ease as we head towards midnight. â€œSo perhaps a bit more drier weather around, some clearer skies but do watch out for those showers and you will also want to wrap up quite warm because although it hasnâ€™t been particularly chilly recently, when you factor in those strong blustery winds, itâ€™s going to feel close to freezing for many places. â€œSo definitely a chilly feel to things as the clock strikes midnight.â€ New Yearâ€™s Day should turn drier for many, particularly across more central southern parts of England and across Scotland with the â€œcentral sliceâ€ of the UK most likely to have showery rain. â€œAs we look through the rest of the first week of 2024 and at the moment Tuesday looks like itâ€™d be a largely dry day with some fine weather around before the return to something more unsettled â€“ some heavy rain, some strong winds, and that does bring the potential for something a little bit colder and possibly wintry,â€ Mr Burkill said. Three men died after their 4Ã—4 vehicle was submerged in the River Esk, near Glaisdale, on Thursday, North Yorkshire Police said. A â€œsupercell thunderstormâ€ that moved across the northwest of England on Thursday after a similar storm is thought to have resulted in a tornado that damaged around 100 homes in Stalybridge, in Tameside, Greater Manchester, on Wednesday. Damage will be covered by standard property insurance policies, the Association of British Insurers has said. ScotRail said many lines have been reopened but urged passengers to check for the latest information before travelling, a message echoed by LNER, Avanti West Coast and London Northwestern Railway who suspended or cancelled services due to damage or system faults. Friday will see significant disruption for travellers wishing to travel on the London Euston and Watford Junction lines with services expected to be up and running by the end of the day. In Wales, the aftermath of the recent severe weather will see rail services hampered until Monday.

author: GlobeNewswire
title: 24Burn Under Review: The Greek Metabolic Water Formula Is Here | The Manila Times
text:
Unlock Metabolic Hydration with 24Burn: The Greek Water Drop Formula That's Helping People Reclaim Energy, Fight Inflammation, and Burn Fat Naturally
New York City, April 23, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) --
Introduction
The Modern Wellness Crisis: Why Are We Always Tired, Inflamed, and Overweight?
In today's fast-paced world, more and more people are waking up feeling exhausted, bloated, and disconnected from their bodies. Despite clean eating, daily workouts, and drinking plenty of water, weight just won't budge, and energy crashes seem inevitable by midday. But there's hope. This cycle often stems from a deeper issue: our metabolism isn't functioning at its full potential, and modern lifestyles may be making it worse. This is where 24Burn steps in, offering a potential solution to this struggle.

author: HT Correspondent
title: Low visibility as fog envelopes Kashmir - Hindustan Times
text: Fog continued to envelope Kashmir for the fifth consecutive day on Friday, effecting the normal life in the Valley. The India Meteorological Department, however, has forecast improvement in visibility from Saturday (December 30) because of a feeble western weather system.Parts of the Valley, including summer capital Srinagar, were seen covered with fog in the morning, disrupting traffic movement and business activities.The MeT said that the weather would continue to be cloudy with dry with moderate to dense fog over plains of Kashmir and Jammu division.â€œThere will be slight improvement in visibility during December 30 and 31 due to approaching feeble western disturbance,â€ said MeTâ€™s Srinagar centre director Mukhtar Ahmad.He added that they expect light snowfall at isolated higher reaches on January 4.â€œFog likely to continue till January 4 due to absence of any major wet spell. Overall, no significant weather activity till the January 4,â€ he added. Independent weather observer Faizan Arif posed on micr-blogging platform â€œXâ€ that the approaching Western Disturbance was set to influence Jammu and Kashmir over Saturday and Sunday, but was unlikely to bring any precipitation.â€œDespite the chance of a slight improvement in foggy conditions over the next 48 hours, ...the forecast indicates that Jammu and Kashmir will continue to experience foggy weather, whether itâ€™s shallow or dense, for the next seven days,â€ he said.Kashmirâ€™s harshest winter period, â€œChilla-i-Kalanâ€, began last week with the mercury dropping several notches below the freezing point at many places.While the day temperatures remain between 8Â°C to 12Â°C, the minimum night temperatures continued to remain below zero on the intervening night of Thursday and Friday in the valley.The southern Konibal area and Pahalgam tourist resort were the coldest at minus 6.5Â°C and minus 5.4Â°C, respectively. The ski resort of Gulmarg in the north recorded temperature of minus 2.5Â°C, the only place with temperature about 3.7 notches higher than the normal at this time.In Srinagar, the temperature was minus 3.3Â°C, about 1.2 notches below normal for the summer capital.The MeT update further added that the gateway to Kashmir in the south, Qazigund recorded a minimum of minus 4.2Â°C and the southern area of Kokernag observed a minimum of minus 2.6Â°C. In north Kashmir, Kupwara recorded a low of minus 4Â°C.Kashmirâ€™s winter pans out in three stages, starting with the 40-day intense period from December 21, followed by 20 days of comparatively less intense chill (Chilla-i-Khurd), and final 10 days of mild cold (Chill-e-Bache).

author: Deutsche Welle
title: Crean mapa unicelular de la piel que permitirÃ­a repararla. â€“ DW â€“ 17/10/2024
text:
La piel es el Ã³rgano mÃ¡s grande del cuerpo y su conocimiento es clave para avanzar en aplicaciones clÃ­nicas. Ahora, cientÃ­ficos han logrado crear un atlas unicelular y espacial de la piel humana prenatal que ofrece una "receta molecular" para construirla y mejorar los trasplantes por quemaduras o alopecia cicatricial.
Gracias a tÃ©cnicas de secuenciaciÃ³n unicelular y otras mÃ©todos genÃ³micos de vanguardia, los investigadores diseÃ±aron este mapa para comprender cÃ³mo se forma la piel, incluidos los folÃ­culos pilosos, y quÃ© es lo que falla en caso de enfermedad. AdemÃ¡s, crearon un "mini Ã³rgano" (organoide) para escudriÃ±ar el papel de las cÃ©lulas inmunitarias en la reparaciÃ³n de este tejido.
La investigaciÃ³n se publica en la revista Nature y la lideran expertos del Instituto Wellcome Sanger y la Universidad de Newcastle (ambos en el Reino Unido). Forma parte del proyecto Atlas Celular Humano (HCA, por sus siglas en inglÃ©s), que estÃ¡ cartografiando todos los tipos celulares del cuerpo humano para transformar la comprensiÃ³n de la salud y la enfermedad.
La piel -con una media de dos metros cuadrados- proporciona una barrera protectora, regula la temperatura corporal y puede regenerarse por sÃ­ misma.
Esta se desarrolla en el entorno estÃ©ril del Ãºtero, con todos los folÃ­culos pilosos formados antes del nacimiento; tras este se produce un ciclo folicular, pero no se forman nuevos. Antes del nacimiento, la piel tiene la capacidad Ãºnica de cicatrizar sin dejar cicatrices, explica un comunicado del Wellcome Sanger.
Ejemplo de alopecia cicatricial. Imagen: Kattyart/Pond5 Images/IMAGO La piel prenatal como factor clave Para confeccionar este atlas, los cientÃ­ficos utilizaron muestras de tejido cutÃ¡neo prenatal, que descompusieron para observar cÃ©lulas individuales en suspensiÃ³n, asÃ­ como cÃ©lulas en su lugar dentro del tejido.
Con tÃ©cnicas genÃ³micas avanzadas analizaron cÃ©lulas individuales en el espacio y el tiempo, y los cambios celulares que regulan el desarrollo de la piel y los folÃ­culos pilosos.
AdemÃ¡s del atlas y utilizando cÃ©lulas madre adultas, los investigadores tambiÃ©n crearon un "mini Ã³rgano" de piel en una placa, conocido como organoide, con capacidad para hacer crecer pelo.
Entre otros, descubrieron que el modelo de organoide se parecÃ­a mÃ¡s a la piel prenatal que a la piel adulta. No obstante, vieron que los vasos sanguÃ­neos no se formaban en el organoide cutÃ¡neo tan bien como en la piel prenatal.
Al aÃ±adir cÃ©lulas inmunitarias conocidas como macrÃ³fagos al organoide, constataron que estos fomentaban la formaciÃ³n de vasos sanguÃ­neos -se realizaron imÃ¡genes en 3D para evaluar la formaciÃ³n de vasos sanguÃ­neos dentro del tejido-.
Se sabe que estas cÃ©lulas inmunitarias protegen la piel de las infecciones. Sin embargo, es la primera vez que se demuestra que los macrÃ³fagos desempeÃ±an un papel clave en la formaciÃ³n de la piel humana durante el desarrollo temprano al favorecer el crecimiento de vasos sanguÃ­neos, aseguran los investigadores.
ee (efe, Nature)

author: News Staff
title: Confirmed measles case was in public in Calgary while infectious: AHS
text:
Alberta Children's Hospital. (Credit: CityNews/Sandra Prusina) By News Staff
Posted Dec 19, 2024 3:28 pm.
Last Updated Dec 19, 2024 3:34 pm.
Alberta Health Services (AHS) is out with a warning about a person with measles who was in several public places in Calgary while infectious.
AHS says the person likely became infected outside of Canada, but arrived back in Calgary last week and has since visited a grocery store in the northeast and the Alberta Childrenâ€™s Hospital.
Anyone in the following locations during the specified day and times could have been exposed:
Dec. 11 â€“ WestJet flight WS1553 from Seattle to Calgary Dec. 11 at 5:55 p.m. to 7:55 p.m. â€“ Calgary International Airport (YYC) Gate D89 Dec. 11 at 6 p.m. to 8:30 p.m. â€“ Calgary International Airport (YYC) international baggage claim area Dec. 11 at 6:30 p.m. to 8:50 p.m. â€“ Calgary International Airport (YYC) international arrivals waiting area Dec. 14 at 3 p.m. to 7 p.m. â€“ Real Canadian Superstore Westwinds (3633 Westwinds Drive NE) Dec. 15 at 12:38 a.m. to 10:47 p.m. â€“ Alberta Childrenâ€™s Hospital emergency department Dec. 15 at 10:24 a.m. to 12:24 p.m. â€“ Alberta Childrenâ€™s Hospital diagnostic imaging department Dec. 15 at 8:47 p.m. to Dec. 17 at 10:08 p.m. â€“ Alberta Childrenâ€™s Hospital unit 4 Those who attended any of those locations during the specified times, was born in 1970 or later, and has less than two documented measles vaccine doses are at risk and should monitor for symptoms, AHS says.
Alberta Health Services (AHS) has confirmed that an individual with lab-confirmed measles has been in public settings in Calgary while infectious. This case is believed to be internationally acquired. More information, visit https://t.co/CtZmLJNgP1 pic.twitter.com/Bv6ZU66Qj5
â€” Alberta Health Services (@AHS_media) December 19, 2024 If symptoms develop, people are being urged to stay home and contact Health Link at 811 before visiting the hospital, or a doctor.
Residents who meet the above criteria and are also pregnant, under one year of age, or have a compromised immune system, are at the greatest risk and should contact Health Link at 811 right away to see if they are eligible for medication.
Measles symptoms include a fever of 38.3 C or higher, along with a cough, runny rose and/or red eyes. A red blotchy rash appears three to seven days after the fever begins, usually starting behind the ears and on the face before spreading down the body.
â€œMeasles is an extremely contagious disease and is spread easily through the air,â€ warns AHS.
The measles vaccine is free in Alberta. Children usually get their first does at 12 months and their second dose at 18 months of age.
